headline: Easy Mango Banana Smoothie
description: This fresh mango banana smoothie made with milk and vanilla yogurt makes a quick, easy, and deliciously creamy breakfast or mid-afternoon snack.
name: Easy Mango Banana Smoothie

recipeInstructions.text: Combine mangos, banana, vanilla yogurt, and milk in a blender; blend until smooth.

review.reviewBody: I love this recipe, I used plain Greek yogurt and sugar free caramel syrup instead of vanilla yogurt! Itâ€™s heavenly!!! Thank you
it was quick to make me and my sister and grandmother really enjoyed it !

use
 frozen mangos

I did 1 cup of everything instead of 2 i also added honey into my smoothie best smoothie ever!!! Really enjoyed this one 
Id say if your using frozen fruits only to thaw them a bit first.
Great smoothie, I have been drinking these after workouts, and i have become very fond of them.
I used frozen mangos and had to estimate the amount, but it was still delicious!
Really tasty, no sugar!
Used 1/2 a cup less milk and added 1-1/2 cups of crushed ice.
I halved the recipe with one banana, one mango and used half silk vanilla yogurt and no milk. Added ice. It is delicious.
Delicious!!! I actually used mango Oikois greek yogurt instead of vanilla yogurt, and frozen mangos instead of fresh ones to make the smoothie colder. Would definitely make again!!
I little too creamy. Add pineapple and orange juice to make it more acidic :-) and ice!!
Very yummy!!!
This is a good smoothie! A little thick so I added in some orange juice.
Very good. Both my mango and banana were frozen. Consequently my smoothie was thick and cold. I loved it!
That was delicious! But as a vegan, I replace regular dairy-products in non-dairy, and added little stevia for sweetener.
I use frozen banana & mango, plain Greek yogurt, almond milk & tsp flaxseed. Just what I need before I going to the gym.
I really loved this drink. I used Almond milk and plain greek yogurt which still tasted very good.
Great smoothie! I used frozen mango pieces, added some vanilla and a little bit of sugar to sweeten just a bit. Thanks for sharing:)
yummy and smooth!
Loved this smoothie! So creamy and delicious and my boyfriend and little man really loved it too. Good way to use mango's. Thanks for the yummy recipe.

Really good recipe. I used frozen banana, and fresh ripe mango from our tree. The frozen banana helps the smoothie to be at a cooler temp., which is critical for me when it comes to smoothies. I did think the banana flavor overwhelms the mango, but it was such a tasty combo that it didn't matter. Everybody loved it. :)

This was such an easy, simple, resource-light smoothie! My only complaint is that the way the recipe calls for ingredients, the banana taste really overpowers the rest of the drink. I toned down the bananas (just enough so that I got the creamy consistency but not the overpowering taste) and added mango nectar. OJ would also work wonders. The drink is absolutely divine!
yes it was fast easy and awesome
We used 3 bananas, and almond milk but no yoghurt. It was delightful. My 9 year old helped make it and we shared it out as morning sunshine in a cup. It went down very quickly.
Good! Added OJ :)

I thought this tasted pretty good. It is not real sweet like many smoothies. I would consider this more of a breakfast smoothie with the dairy products. The dairy products also made it more creamy. I used organic vanilla bean yogurt and reduced fat milk. I like my smoothies extra cold, so I made 2 servings and added 2 ice cubes along with the banana being frozen. ty
Delicious! Next time I will add ice to make it more chilled.
IT WAS REALLY GOOD AND EASY, COULD HAVE USED A LIL BIT MORE MANGO TASTE BUT MY SON AND I REALLY LIKED IT
I cut this recipe back by half and used vanilla greek yogurt. My oldest and I liked it alright but the youngest REALLY liked it.

I pretty much welcome any smoothie that doesn't rely on one berry or another so this one appealed to me. With only plain Greek yogurt on hand, I added vanilla and a little sugar. My mango was cold, and the banana ripe and frozen. I thought the mango flavor could have been a little more bold, but Hubs liked its subtleness. An overused word to describe this maybe, but we both found it refreshing.
quick, easy and healthy! perfect trifecta! thanks!

Thie smoothie recipe has been way overlooked. I find that it is just perfect. I halved it and it is so easy to remember. 4 ingredients: 1-1-1-1. Easy to make, easy to remember. How much better can you get?
Pretty close to perfect! I used frozen mango so there was almost no effort involved.
